title.value: Studying the challenges of developing hardware description language programs
title.justification: The title is clearly mentioned at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Studying the challenges of developing hardware description language programs

extractions.description: This paper investigates the challenges faced in developing hardware description language (HDL) programs by analyzing questions from online forums. It explores different types of questions, identifies the most challenging topics for HDL developers, and suggests opportunities for improvements in HDL development practices.

type.justification: The research involves examining data from Stack Exchange forums using qualitative and quantitative analyses, which aligns with empirical research methods.
type.quote: Through qualitative analysis, topic modeling, and quantitative analysis, we examined the types of questions, the questions’ topics, and identified the most challenging topics for developers.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on Hardware Description Languages and the specific challenges encountered in their development.
name.quote: Context: Developing domain specific architectures (e.g., Google’s TPU) typically requires writing programs in Hardware Description Languages (HDLs).

name.justification: The paper discusses improvements in software engineering practices to support HDL development.
name.quote: Objective: We believe that our software engineering community should pay more attention to supporting HDL development.

name.justification: The method section of the paper emphasizes qualitative analysis as part of its research methodology.
name.quote: Method: Through qualitative analysis, topic modeling, and quantitative analysis, we examined the types of questions, the questions’ topics, and identified the most challenging topics for developers.
